description: From im- +‎ paradise. Compare French emparadiser.

verbs.description: imparadise (third-person singular simple present imparadises, present participle imparadising, simple past and past participle imparadised)

entries.meaning: (transitive, poetic) To place in paradise; to put in a state like paradise; to make supremely happy.
examples: Then, as all my soules bee,
I understand, and grow and see,)
The rafters of my body, bone
Being still with you, the Muscle, Sinew, and Veine,
Which tile this house, will come againe.

entries.meaning: (transitive, poetic) To transform into a paradise.
examples: O my bright louely Brooke, whose name doth beare the sound
Of Gods first Garden-plot, th’imparadized ground,
Wherein he placed Man, from whence by sinne he fell.
